answers.answer: Your dog should only eat dog food.  No people food.Yes, chocolate can be deadly.
well thats a lie my dog got in to 1 no two large bag of chocolate and a 1 pound bar of chocolate in a week  and he is steel liveing and it's been 1 year and nothing

My mini pin is upchunking and then sowoling it a lot and i'am feeding him alittile over a cup a day of food so any one got any idea please let me now please i love me dogs and your help great full thanks

Your min pin should only have high quality dog food, Little Bites, and be fed once a day.  NO CHOCOLATE.. it is poisonous for dogs.  If your dog is throwing up now it could be from the damage done by the chocolate. Take it to your vet and find out why he is sick.  They are also prone to diabetes.  My min pin had to be put down at age 5 due to diabetes complications.  They tend to gain weight also after spaying or neutering.  NO table scraps.  If your dog is fed the proper way there should be no problems.

Min pins should never have chocolate.  It is poisonous whether eaten in small amts. or large.  Just because your dog doesn't die after eating it doesn't mean that damage hasn't been done ... and may be noticed later.  They should NOT be fed table scraps.  Min pins are also prone to diabetes and they sometimes gain weight after neutering or spaying.  Keep the food proportioned to once a day and never over 1/2 to 1 cup.  Plenty of water should be available.  Hope this helps!

1 day ago we adopted a 4 yr old femail min pin from a family who is moving and could not keep her. She (Squirt) is a darling and seems to be settling in. I thought that your advice about what to feed this small dog made a lot of sense and so I wonder if I could ask you about how to judge when such a small dog may have to go outside. It is very cold here right now with lots of snow on the ground. She has a sweater. Is it best for me to just keep taking her out or wait for her to signal me when she wants to go? Her former owners were very emotional about giving her up and were not very forthcoming about some details. I'd appreciate your opinion about the potty issue. Thank you.
